Domain related

Scope

Products in scope

The first level of the list are products in scope, the second level are existing login screens or login capabilities

  • CXI

    • Core Platform (Hyde Park)

    • Possibly User Facing Part (Greenwich) TO BE CLARIFIEDRed

  • EFS Admin

    • www

    • fm

    • reports

    • service layer

  • Portals

  • Panelwebsite

  • Datavoyager

    • Admin

    • Reportmanager

    • Unclear if there is something additional to be clarifiedRed

  • Tivian Analytics

  • Dashboards

  • Service Layers (of all platforms if necessary)

Products out of scope

  • Tableau (sync will stay as is)

  • Forum (Unipark)

  • G2 (legacy Guidespark Platform)

  • Orgadmin view / Download Platform

Users in scope

  • EFS Admins

  • DXI Panelists

  • CXI Admins

  • CXI Targeted Audience Members? to be clarifiedRed

  • DV Admins

  • Reportmanager Users?

Features

Service Layer

The EFS service layer currently could be used by a token or by a username and password mechanism. The username and password mechanism should be removed if possible. So no password are needed anymore

Adding OIDC flows it optional and can be done later.

Authorization

Authorization should stay in each solution. That means each solution will manage their own user rights and has to keep user records.

Passwords

A goals of the Identity Provider will be to remove all kinds of password from every solution other than the IdP itself.

Federation / SSO

Federation with other identity provider is a must. This is especially federating authentication. User creation will not be part of the first iteration.

It is not clear if that fits enough use cases. Especially the customized SSO solutions might be using user ingestions / just-in-time provisioning. This is at least a desired feature by many customers TO BE CLARIFIEDRed

User Data

The user data should only consist of email-address and password - credential relevant data.

It is unclear if a username flow should be supported that either username or email-address could be used. to be clarifiedRed

It shall be possible to change the email address. Therefore after registration an identifier like the Identity Provider ID has to be stored an used. When an email address is changed then the other systems get updated as soon as the specific user logs in again. ( TO BE CLARIFIEDRed also kafka might be used for that - meaning every system should be connected to kafka reading user-changed messages from it)

It is not 100% clear if that is possible and all users use an email address. It is at least a desired feature of some customers that more data is stored from their identity provider in combination with JIT. to be clarifiedRed

Each system should sync their users to the identity provider. Each system has to implement such a mechanism.

There should be a user registration for Portals, Panelwebsite and CXI. The Identity provider should just be one part of this handling the credentials only.

There must be a mechanism to finally/permanently delete users. That means if a user gets deleted from a system and unassigned from the identity provider it will get deleted entirely from the identity provider if the user is not assigned to any application anymore.

Authentication mechanisms

Multi Factor Authentication should be possible. It should at least support authenticator apps and email MFA.

A dashboard for users after they log in could be added. So that users that login without initially entering one of our application URLs will be forwarded to a dashboard that shows the applications they are assigned to. Then they can click on the application an get forwarded to it.

There should be an option to skip the screen of our identity provider when an external identity provider is used. That means a user will get directly forwarded from our identity provider to the external identity provider.

A passwordless authentication mechanism is not expected by our current customers and there might be too few customers to use or be able to use such a mechanism.

A reset password flow must be present.

Emails

Some customers are managing their users on their own. Therefore contact data should be adaptable in the emails.

Emails should always be send through the hurricane or a similar service. This is important for customers to keep their IP allow-listing for emails.

Design of the emails → see customization below

Emails in scope are:

  • Password reset (containing a one-time link)

  • User activation (also containing a one-time link)

  • Registration (email confirmation?!)

  • …this has to be detailed out - most likely there are more emails depending on the flow to be clarifiedRed

Customization

A configurable customization of all screens has to be possible. This will be colors of the tenant and a logo. The same is true for emails.

It would be best if an embedding of the Identity Provider screens as iframe would be possible. Especially the login screen and the registration screen. This would enable designs around the login login screen etc.

It has to be clarified if allowing iframes is a problem from a security perspective when it comes to the login screen etc. to be clarifiedRed

Root User

No local root user should be kept in the applications. Users get the access right of an admin or a qbonly admin. This means there are no credentials kept in the applications.

Admin users should be forced to use at least multi-factor authentication.

Maintenance

The must be a sufficient set of maintenance scripts (or a UI) for the support. Those should especially align with our typical flows instead of generic identity provider functions. That could be something like a script to setup an installation (this would create an application and multiple kinds of groups).

We should ask support what would be nice to have there. to be clarifiedRed

A self-registration for customers might be a helpful addition so that customers can test their identity provider setup without our involvement. (like testing if every field is at the correct place etc.) to be clarifiedRed

Groups and Applications/Clients

Each customer/tenant should get a group with all users of that tenant. That group should contain the tenant wide policies and configuration.

There will be a group for a specific application containing the members of that application.

Applications spread accross multiple modules. The following applications should exist:

  • Tivian Analytics [one for all]

  • Dashboard (check if that could be one together with Tivian Analytics?! to be clarifiedRed ) [one for all]

  • CXI [one for all]

  • EFS including Portals and Panelwebsite [one per installation]

  • Datavoyager (clarify if reportmanager is included or should get it’s own application to be clarifiedRed ) [one per installation]

Policies

There should be policies in place for different flows and use cases.

  • Password policy: Managing what passwords are allowed (should be individual per tenant)

  • MFA policy: Managing when to enroll and request what kind of MFA (should be indiviual per tenant)

  • Authentication policy: Managing how a user can login and how long token times, session times etc. will be (unclear if it is needed to have that individual per tenant)

Organisational

Rough Project Plan

  • Start with an MVP Identity Provider

  • In Parallel

    • Build a production ready identity provider

    • In series

      • Build an admin integration in DV (very few users, easy to handle, good for testing)

      • Build the EFS admin integration and other admin integrations

  • Build a panelist integration as well as other enduser integrations (if present)
